Interface TypeTagValidator

All Known Implementing Classes:
PhoneNumber.Validator
public interface TypeTagValidator
Implemented by classes capable of runtime validation of values whose types are annotated with a @TypeTag meta-annotated annotation.

Note: Implementations of this interface must have a public default constructor.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    default boolean
    isValid(Class<? extends Annotation> annotationType, Object value)
    Determine whether the given value is valid according to the given specification.

    Validate the given value according to the given @TypeTag annotation type.

  • Method Details

    • validate

      void validate(Class<? extends Annotation> annotationType, Object value)
      Validate the given value according to the given @TypeTag annotation type.

      Invalid values trigger a ClassCastException in order to remain "backward compatible" with normal Java casts. However, if the value is invalid because of its value rather its runtime type, it is preferrable to throw the more specific type TypeRestrictionException.

      Whether this method admits null values is up to the implementation, but typically implementations would always allow null values, since those can be checked separately (e.g., via &#64;NonNull).

      Checking @TypeTag.restrictTo() at Runtime

      If @TypeTag.restrictTo() is non-empty, this method is responsible for validating that value is an instance of one of the specified types. Since throwing ClassCastException is how this method reports an invalid value, in many cases this check happens automatically.

      Note also that primitive types in @TypeTag.restrictTo() must be handled specially: at runtime, primitive values will be wrapped by the time this method sees them, so this method may need to map any primitive types in @TypeTag.restrictTo() to their corresponding wrapper types (e.g., via the utility method TypeUtil.primitiveToWrapper()).

      Parameters:
      annotationType - @TypeTag meta-annotated annotation type; must not be null
      value - the value to validate
      Throws:
      ClassCastException - if value is invalid
      TypeRestrictionException - if value is invalid due to its value rather than its runtime type
      NullPointerException - if annotationType is null

    • isValid

      default boolean isValid(Class<? extends Annotation> annotationType, Object value)
      Determine whether the given value is valid according to the given specification.

      The implementation in TypeTagValidator invokes validate() and returns false if that method throws a ClassCastException, otherwise true.

      Parameters:
      annotationType - @TypeTag meta-annotated annotation type; must not be null
      value - the value to validate
      Returns:
      true if value is valid for annotationType, otherwise false
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if annotationType is null
